articles.title: Coronavirus UK: Tiny remote town has the highest infection rate in UK - Metro.co.uk
articles.description: Experts have struggled to explain why the small industrial town has turned into a hotspot for the virus.
articles.content:
Barrow-in-Furness, which has a population of 67,000 people, has a rate of 882 cases per 100,000 people (Picture: Shutterstock / Neil Mitchell)
One of the most remote towns in the country has suffered the highest coronavirus infection rate in the UK, accordin… [+5411 chars]

articles.author: By Vanessa Chalmers Health Reporter For Mailonline
articles.title: Coronavirus test results from thousands of people are 'disappearing into a black hole' - Daily Mail
articles.description: Authorities across the country say they can no longer access data for tests conducted outside NHS hospitals which helps them control outbreaks locally.
articles.content:
Britain's testing fiasco has deepened again today amid claims test results of tens of thousands of people have 'disappeared into a black hole'.
Authorities across the UK say they can no longer access data for swabs conducted outside NHS hospitals, which help… [+7864 chars]

articles.author: By Stephen Matthews Health Editor For Mailonline Sam Blanchard Senior Health Reporter For Mailonline
articles.title: Real care home death toll in England and Wales could be as high as 22,000 - Daily Mail
articles.description: Official data yesterday showed more than 8,000 COVID-19-related deaths in care homes had been recorded in the two countries by the start of May, but experts say there are considerably more.
articles.content:
More than 22,000 care home residents across England and Wales may have already died as a result of the coronavirus outbreak, according to a grim analysis. 
Official data yesterday showed almost 9,000 COVID-19-related deaths in care homes had been recorded in… [+14361 chars]

articles.author: Sky
articles.title: Coronavirus: UK might use sewage to track coronavirus hotspots - Sky News
articles.description: By looking at waste water, scientists could be able to track the way the virus moves through communities.
